articles.title: Bitcoin at $150,000 by 2026? Prediction Markets Are Skeptical -- Long-Term Investors Should Pay Attention to the Odds.
articles.summary: Prediction markets are pricing Bitcoin's chances of hitting $150,000 by 2026 at surprisingly low odds, creating a stark disconnect between crypto enthusiasts and professional forecasters. Smart money is essentially calling bullshit on the moonshot predictions, which means there's either easy money to be made on the long side or the crowd knows something the HODLers don't.

articles.title: Kash: $2 Million Raised To Bring Prediction Markets To Social Media
articles.summary: Kash just closed a $2M funding round to integrate prediction markets directly into social media platforms. If they crack the code on making betting as viral as TikTok dances, we're looking at the mainstreaming moment that turns prediction markets from niche hobby to mass obsession.

articles.title: NBA star's partnership with a prediction market raises new questions for a troubled sports betting landscape
articles.summary: An NBA player has partnered with a prediction market platform, adding another layer of complexity to sports betting's already messy regulatory and ethical landscape. The move signals prediction markets are aggressively courting mainstream sports figures, but it also hands regulators and leagues fresh ammunition to crack down on an industry they're already eyeing suspiciously.

articles.title: ‘Insane This Is Legal’: Democrats Allege Trumpworld Insiders May Be Betting on War in Iran
articles.source: NOTUS — News of the United States
articles.summary: Democrats are accusing Trump associates of placing bets on whether the US will go to war with Iran, calling the practice legally questionable but not explicitly banned. If true, it highlights how prediction markets can create perverse incentives when bettors have inside information or influence over the outcomes they're wagering on.

articles.title: ‘We Need Answers!’ Congressman Calls Out Polymarket Bettor Who Scored More Than $500K ‘Overnight’ On Iran Strike
articles.summary: A congressman is demanding answers from a Polymarket bettor who made over $500K on Iran strike predictions in a single night. The scrutiny signals Washington's growing concern that prediction markets might be moving on insider information rather than public analysis.

articles.title: 2 of the Best Prediction Market Stocks to Buy Now
articles.summary: Some finance publication is pushing prediction market stocks as hot investment picks right now. If these companies are getting Wall Street attention, it probably means the sector is hitting mainstream momentum that could bring more liquidity and legitimacy to the markets we actually bet on.

articles.title: Prediction markets indicate oil pop Monday, 20% rise this month
articles.summary: Prediction markets are betting on oil prices surging Monday and climbing 20% through the month, signaling traders expect a major supply disruption or geopolitical shock. The crude oil spike represents one of the biggest monthly moves markets are pricing in this year, creating serious profit opportunities for anyone positioned ahead of the crowd.

articles.title: Bet on Anything, Everywhere, All at Once
articles.summary: The prediction markets space is exploding into every corner of human activity, from pop culture to politics to personal life events. This expansion means more liquidity, better price discovery, and fresh opportunities for sharp bettors to find edge in markets that traditional bookmakers ignore.

articles.title: Polymarket defends its decision to allow betting on war as ‘invaluable’
articles.summary: Polymarket is pushing back against criticism of its war-related betting markets, calling them "invaluable" for information discovery. The defense signals prediction markets are doubling down on controversial topics despite regulatory pressure, potentially setting the stage for broader fights over what can and can't be traded.

articles.title: Anonymous Kalshi User Makes Huge Bet That the White House Is About to Confirm Alien Life or Technology
articles.summary: Someone just dropped serious money on Kalshi betting that the White House will officially acknowledge extraterrestrial life or technology in the near future. If they're right, it would trigger one of the biggest prediction market payouts in history while proving that sometimes the wildest bets capture real insider information before traditional media catches on.

articles.title: Are Prediction Markets Mirroring Crypto's Boom?
articles.summary: Prediction markets are experiencing explosive growth that eerily resembles crypto's early meteoric rise, complete with surging user bases, massive funding rounds, and mainstream media attention. If the parallel holds, we're either about to see prediction markets become as ubiquitous as Bitcoin trading, or we're heading for a spectacular crash that takes half the platforms with it.

articles.title: Kalshi bets on Neal Katyal in prediction market cases
articles.summary: Kalshi has hired high-profile Supreme Court attorney Neal Katyal to represent them in legal battles over prediction market regulation. The move signals Kalshi expects serious courtroom fights ahead as they push to expand beyond election betting into more controversial markets that regulators want to block.
